field.comment: A human readable name for this provider
field.name: name

field.comment: The application this provider is active on
field.name: webApplicationId

field.comment: By default we will take the host provided by the web application. But you can register a custom host for redirect uri generation.
field.name: host

field.comment: We assume you are capturing the response of the OAuth2 provider in your own application. This is the path to the correct file (defaults to "/")
field.name: processPath

field.comment: Once a user requests a login, how long is that particular request valid?
field.name: maximumLoginWait

field.comment: You may need to use a custom http client to get this to work
field.name: httpClientId

field.comment: A space separated list of scopes you want to request
field.name: requestedScopes

field.comment: A space separated list of scopes that exist
field.name: availableScopes

field.comment: The endpoint where we can resolve the token.
field.name: tokenEndpoint

field.comment: The endpoint where the user is redirected to to log in
field.name: authorizationEndpoint

field.comment: Might be specific to a resource
field.name: resource

field.comment: Defaults to POST. But some, like facebook, use a GET. This field is case insenstive
field.name: tokenMethod

field.comment: The service that can be used to resolve the user info
field.name: userInfoServiceId

field.comment: The service that can be used to get the token
field.name: tokenServiceId

field.comment: The service that can be used to get the redirect uri
field.name: redirectUriServiceId

field.comment: When creating new accounts, the default alias type to (attempt to) use: email, phone, id (default is email)
field.name: aliasType

field.comment: If set to true, you can only log in with existing accounts. No new accounts will be created.
field.name: mustExist
